sentences.en: An oath was administered to the newly elected President.
sentences.cn: 新当选的总统执行了宣誓手续.

sentences.en: Evidence is given on oath and witnesses are subject to cross - examination .
sentences.cn: 证人宣誓后作证,并接受 盘问.

sentences.en: He threw it aside with an impatient gesture and another oath and walked off.
sentences.cn: 他不耐烦地把它扔到一边，又骂了一句，然后走开了。

sentences.en: He took an oath that he had seen the defendant leaving the scene of crime.
sentences.cn: 他赌咒曾看到过被告从犯罪现场离开.

sentences.en: He was willing to take his oath to all he said.
sentences.cn: 他愿对他所说的一切起誓.

sentences.en: His girlfriend had gone into the witness box and taken the oath.
sentences.cn: 他的女朋友进入证人席并立了誓。

sentences.en: I administer the oath to him.
I have sworn an oath to defend her.
She could not break her oath .
The constitution requires members of parliament to take an oath of allegiance.
sentences.cn: 宪法规定，议员必须宣誓效忠。

sentences.en: The judge reminded the witness that he was still under oath.
sentences.cn: 法官提醒证人,他已发过誓要说实话.

sentences.en: The president took the oath of office (= made the official public promises that every president makes when starting their job ) .
They swore an oath of loyalty to the country.
They swore an oath to carry out their duties faithfully.
sentences.cn: 他们宣誓忠实履行自己的职责.

sentences.en: Three officers gave evidence on oath against him.
sentences.cn: 3位警官经宣誓提出了对他不利的证据。

sentences.en: Under oath, Aston finally admitted that he had lied.
sentences.cn: 在宣誓的约束下，阿斯顿终于承认自己撒了谎。

sentences.en: Witnesses are required to take the oath (= make this promise ) .

phrases.tran_cn: [医]希波克拉底氏誓言（立誓拯救人命及遵守医业准绳）
(澳/新西兰)（用于表示同意或认可的呼喊语） 我同意

trans.tran_cn: 誓言，誓约，妄用神名，渎神的言词，[法]宣誓，诅咒，咒骂语
trans.tran_en: a formal and very serious promise
